Jerry walks into his apartment, excitedly holding a brand new iPhone. "Hey, George, check it out!" he says, waving the phone around. "I just bought the newest iPhone!"

George, sitting on the couch scrolling through Facebook, looks up. "Oh, that's nice," he says, before returning to his phone.

Elaine walks in, carrying a bag of groceries. "What's going on?" she asks, setting the groceries down on the kitchen counter.

"Jerry just bought the new iPhone," George says, still scrolling through Facebook.

Elaine glances over at Jerry's phone, impressed. "Wow, that's great! I've been thinking about getting one myself."

Suddenly, George gasps and puts down his phone. "Oh no," he says, his face turning pale. "I just saw that my ex-girlfriend just changed her Facebook status to 'single.' She just broke up with me on Facebook!"

Jerry and Elaine exchange a concerned look. "That's rough, George," Jerry says, trying to comfort his friend.

"I can't believe she would do that," George says, shaking his head. "I thought we had a good relationship!"

Elaine puts a hand on George's shoulder. "It's okay, George," she says. "You'll find someone else. In fact, I met a really cute guy on Tinder last night. We're going on a date tonight."

Jerry and George exchange a skeptical look. "Tinder, huh?" Jerry says, raising an eyebrow. "Well, good luck with that."

Elaine laughs. "Thanks, I'll need it. But at least I'm not getting dumped on Facebook like poor George here."

"Hey, I'm not that poor," George protests, but the three friends can't help but laugh.

The episode opens with Jerry, Elaine, George, and Kramer walking down a dark, empty street. They are all dressed in Halloween costumes and carrying trick-or-treat bags.

"I can't believe we're out trick-or-treating in our thirties," Elaine says, rolling her eyes.

"Come on, Elaine, it's Halloween!" Jerry says, grinning. "You're never too old to enjoy a good spook."

As they continue walking, they hear a strange noise behind them. They turn to see a group of menacing-looking teenagers following them.

"What do they want?" George asks, his voice trembling.

"I don't know, but we need to get out of here," Kramer says, quickening his pace.

The group begins to run, but the teenagers are gaining on them. Suddenly, they come to a dead end and are trapped.

"What are we going to do?" Elaine asks, panic rising in her voice.

Just then, a creepy old house appears out of nowhere. "Quick, in here!" Jerry says, leading the group inside.

Once inside, they find themselves in a maze of dark, twisted corridors. "We need to find a way out of here," Kramer says, his eyes scanning the area.

As they continue to search for an exit, they are suddenly confronted by a group of ghosts. "Trick or treat!" the ghosts chorus, their eyes glowing with an otherworldly light.

The group screams in terror and begins to run, but the ghosts are hot on their heels. Finally, they reach a door and manage to escape, panting and out of breath.

They emerge from the house and into the bright daylight, relieved to be safe. "Well, that was one Halloween we'll never forget," Elaine says, shaking her head.

The episode ends with the group laughing and reminiscing about their terrifying Halloween adventure, directed by the master of horror, John Carpenter.
